intro: Teclea punctata, commonly known as the spotted teclea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. Teclea punctata is often found in woodland areas and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
